msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A Breviary of the Use of Ghent containing a calendar, tables, ferial psalter, and concluding prayers added in a different, but early, hand. Amendations to the calendar indicate a change of use early in the manuscript's history. The major textual divisions are marked by illuminated letters two-to-five lines high and three- or four-sided panels of acanthus leaf sprays.

msItem.title: Ferial Psalter followed by litany, petitions, and collects
Office of the Virgin for Advent
Prayers to martyrs, Bonaventure, Louis, Elzéar, and Anastasia [in a different hand]

supportDesc.extent: iiii+329+iii; 148 x 106 mm bound to 155 x 117 mm

layoutDesc.layout: Thirty-two lines per page in two columns, ruled in ink; written area: 106 x 74 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: The major textual divisions are marked by illuminated letters two-to-five lines high and three- or four-sided panels of acanthus leaf sprays

binding.p: Brown morocco with gold edges, in a case
